channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Photos: 2026 Golden Globes Red Carpet
item.description: The brightest stars in TV and film kicked off the 83rd annual Golden Globes tonight in Beverly Hills, Calif. with Ariana Grande, Noah Wyle, Teyana Taylor and George Clooney are just some the names who walked the red carpet.
item.content:encoded:
The brightest stars in TV and film kicked off the 83rd annual Golden Globes tonight in Beverly Hills, Calif. with Ariana Grande, Noah Wyle, Teyana Taylor and George Clooney are just some the names who walked the red carpet.

(Image credit: Jordan Strauss/Invision)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: These are the 2026 Golden Globe winners
item.description: Timothée Chalamet, Teyana Taylor, Jessie Buckley and Noah Wyle all took home acting prizes at Sunday night's awards.
item.content:encoded:
Timothée Chalamet, Teyana Taylor, Jessie Buckley and Noah Wyle all took home acting prizes at Sunday night's awards.

(Image credit: Etienne Laurent)
item.dc:creator: Clare Lombardo

item.title: National Portrait Gallery removes impeachment references next to Trump photo
item.description: A new portrait of President Trump is on display at the National Portrait Gallery's "America's Presidents" exhibition. Text accompanying the portrait removes references to Trump's impeachments.
item.content:encoded:
A new portrait of President Trump is on display at the National Portrait Gallery's "America's Presidents" exhibition. Text accompanying the portrait removes references to Trump's impeachments.

(Image credit: Rod Lamkey)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: Pet theory
item.description: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer plays the puzzle with KAMW listener Daniel Abramson of Albuquerque, N.M, and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Sacha Pfeiffer plays the puzzle with KAMW listener Daniel Abramson of Albuquerque, N.M, and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: Veteran actor T.K. Carter, known for 'The Thing' and 'Punky Brewster,' dies at 69
item.description: T.K. Carter gained fame as Nauls the cook in John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic, "The Thing."
item.content:encoded:
T.K. Carter gained fame as Nauls the cook in John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic, "The Thing."

(Image credit: Mary Altaffer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Washington National Opera leaves Kennedy Center, joining slew of artist exits
item.description: The WNO is just the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.
item.content:encoded: The WNO is just the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for January 10, 2026: With Not My Job guest Delroy Lindo
item.description: This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guest Delroy Lindo and panelists Paula Poundstone, Joyelle Nicole Johnson, and Roy Blount, Jr.
item.content:encoded:
This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guest Delroy Lindo and panelists Paula Poundstone, Joyelle Nicole Johnson, and Roy Blount, Jr.

(Image credit: Michael Tran)

item.title: 2026 looks ominous for media, from Hollywood to journalism
item.description: Critic at large Eric Deggans says that in 2026, audiences have more power than they realize to determine the future of news and entertainment.
item.content:encoded:
Critic at large Eric Deggans says that in 2026, audiences have more power than they realize to determine the future of news and entertainment.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Eric Deggans

item.title: 'Heavyweight' podcast host Jonathan Goldstein on whether people can really change
item.description: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't ask. Heavyweight podcast host Jonathan Goldstein tackles the question of whether people can really change.
item.content:encoded: On Wild Card, well-known guests answer the kinds of questions we often think about but don't ask. Heavyweight podcast host Jonathan Goldstein tackles the question of whether people can really change.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Martin

item.title: After years of avoiding the ER, Noah Wyle feels 'right at home' in 'The Pitt'
item.description: After 11 seasons on ER, Wyle is producing, writing and starring in The Pitt. Now in Season 2, the series has earned praise for its depiction of emergency medicine. Originally broadcast April 21, 2025.
item.content:encoded: After 11 seasons on ER, Wyle is producing, writing and starring in The Pitt. Now in Season 2, the series has earned praise for its depiction of emergency medicine. Originally broadcast April 21, 2025.
item.dc:creator: Dave Davies
